name: Imran Khan Cancer Appeal USA
mission: TO GENERATE CHARITABLE DONATIONS FOR HELPING IN THE TREATMENT OF CANCER IN THIRD WORLD COUNTRIES AND THE ESTABLISHMENT OF THE SHAUKAT KHANUM MEMORIAL CANCER HOSPITAL AND RESEARCH CENTER. SPECIFIC GOALS INCLUDE (1) TO INITIATE CHARITABLE FUND RAISING ACTIVITIES, (2) TO RECRUIT PROFESSIONAL AND NON- PROFESSIONAL STAFF AND EXPENSES FOR THE ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICE, (3) TO SUPPLY FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR THE PAYMENT OF MEDICINES, DIAGNOSTIC AND THERAPEUTIC EQUIPMENT FOR THE SHAUKAT KHANUM MEMORIAL CANCER HOSPITAL AND RESEARCH CENTER. (4) TO ASSIST IN THE RECRUITMENT OF ALL MEDICAL AND ANCILLARY PERSONNEL FOR THE SHAUKAT KHANUM MEMORIAL CANCER HOSPITAL AND RESEARCH CENTER.
programs: Cancer Registry and Clinical Data Management
theoryOfChange: By providing state-of-the-art treatment regardless of ability to pay and conducting regional research, the hospital aims to reduce cancer mortality and suffering in Pakistan.
zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://www.shaukatkhanum.org.pk/zakat (Source: https://www.shaukatkhanum.org.pk/zakat)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Context dependent profile. Consider cause fit, risk profile, and evidence maturity before deciding.

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Asnaf: fi_sabilillah (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Humanitarian service (+2)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or regions with limited nonprofit coverage
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 38/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, global health cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data; high program ratio (≥85%) suggests efficient delivery
components.improvement_suggestion: Track and report beneficiary counts to enable cost analysis
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Document a clear theory of change with causal pathway
components.name: Theory of Change

risks.risk_summary: Key concern: Board too small: 1 members

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: Imran Khan Cancer Appeal, Inc. shows strong alignment and good impact, with zakat compliance (significant risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://www.shaukatkhanum.org.pk/zakat (Source: https://www.shaukatkhanum.org.pk/zakat)

all_citations.claim: The charity holds a 95.0/100 rating and maintains a program expense ratio of 97.4%.
The organization is Zakat-eligible and follows specific asnaf categories for distribution.
Total revenue was $17,974,012, with fundraising efficiency at $0.02 per $1 raised and 9.8 months of working capital.
The charity provides various donation options and methods for supporting cancer treatment services.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a 61/100 GMG score due to its outstanding financial efficiency and high alignment with donor values, though its overall impact score is moderated by the direct service nature of its work.
areas_for_improvement: Enhancing data confidence through increased third-party impact verification and reporting.
Expanding the breadth of public program evaluations to further justify impact scores.

dimension_explanations.alignment: With an alignment score of 38/50, the charity shows high donor fit, particularly for those seeking Zakat-eligible causes in global health [2]. The mission addresses the urgent need for cancer treatment in third-world countries, supported by a transparent Zakat policy and multiple giving methods for supporters [2][4].
dimension_explanations.impact: The charity demonstrates a direct service model through its SKM Cancer Trust, clinical services, and diagnostic programs [3]. While it maintains a high Charity Navigator score of 95.0/100 and a program expense ratio of 97.4%, the impact score of 30/50 reflects a balanced view of its direct medical interventions and the available evidence of long-term cost-effectiveness [1][3].

baseline_narrative.headline: Imran Khan Cancer Appeal, Inc. provides life-saving oncological care to underserved populations through a highly efficient, Zakat-eligible financial model.
strengths: Exceptional program expense ratio of 97.4%, ensuring the vast majority of funds go directly to clinical and diagnostic services.
Highly efficient fundraising operations, spending only $0.02 to raise every $1.
Strong short-term financial health with 9.8 months of working capital available.
baseline_narrative.summary: Imran Khan Cancer Appeal, Inc. is a non-profit organization dedicated to funding cancer treatment in developing nations, primarily supporting the Shaukat Khanum Memorial Cancer Hospital and Research Centre [1][3]. The organization is verified as Zakat-eligible, maintaining a transparent policy to ensure funds reach eligible patients in accordance with Islamic principles [2][4].
